description: User wants more competitors added to the list

competitors.name: Notion
competitors.description: All-in-one workspace for notes, docs, and databases

user_feedback: Add more competitors, especially enterprise-focused ones
expected_behavior: Output should include original competitors plus new enterprise-focused ones

description: User wants to narrow focus to mobile apps only
user_feedback: Focus only on mobile-first apps, remove desktop-focused ones
expected_behavior: Output should emphasize mobile-first competitors like Bear, possibly add more mobile apps

description: User wants more detail on specific gaps

problems.title: No mobile-first power tool
problems.description: Most note-taking apps treat mobile as secondary.
evidence: Users complain about mobile UX on Reddit

user_feedback: Expand on the mobile-first gap with more evidence and specific pain points
expected_behavior: The mobile-first gap should have more detailed evidence and pain points

problems.title: Steep learning curve
problems.description: Power tools like Notion/Obsidian are complex

user_feedback: What about collaboration? Team features seem lacking in local-first tools.
additional_context: Domain: Note-taking, Competitors analyzed: Notion, Obsidian, Bear
expected_behavior: Should add a gap about collaboration/team features while preserving existing gap

description: User wants a simpler, more focused problem statement

original_output.title: Mobile-First Knowledge Management for Professional Knowledge Workers
original_output.content: Professional knowledge workers need a mobile-first note-taking solution that combines the power of desktop tools like Notion with the speed and simplicity required for on-the-go capture, while maintaining privacy through local-first architecture and enabling seamless offline sync.
original_output.target_user: Professional knowledge workers aged 25-45 who manage complex projects across multiple devices
validation_questions: Would you pay $10/month for a mobile note-taking app with desktop-quality features?
How many times per day do you capture notes on mobile vs desktop?

user_feedback: Too complex. Simplify to focus on just the mobile capture problem.
expected_behavior: Simpler problem statement focused specifically on mobile capture, fewer differentiators

description: User corrects wrong information in a competitor profile

original_output.name: Obsidian
original_output.features_summary: Markdown-based note-taking with linking and plugins. Requires monthly subscription.

user_feedback: This is wrong - Obsidian is free for personal use, and it DOES have a mobile app
expected_behavior: Corrected pricing (free for personal) and removed 'No mobile app' from weaknesses
